Class DifficultyManager

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.game.DifficultyManager
public class DifficultyManager extends Object
DifficultyManager - Manages game difficulty levels and their associated game speeds. Handles the mapping between difficulty levels (1, 5, 10, 15) and brick fall speeds. Level 1 is the easiest (the slowest fall), and Level 15 is the hardest (the fastest fall). Responsibilities: - Store and retrieve current difficulty level - Calculate brick fall delay based on difficulty level - Provide difficulty descriptions for UI display

  • Method Details

    • setLevel

      public void setLevel(int level)
      Sets the current difficulty level. Valid levels: 1, 5, 10, 15
      Parameters:
      level - the difficulty level to set
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a level is not a valid difficulty level

    • getCurrentLevel

      public int getCurrentLevel()
      Gets the current difficulty level.
      Returns:
      the current difficulty level (1, 5, 10, or 15)

    • getDelayForCurrentLevel

      public int getDelayForCurrentLevel()
      Gets the brick fall delay in milliseconds for the current difficulty level. Lower delay = faster falling = harder difficulty. Level 1: 1000 ms (Normal) Level 5: 700 ms (Medium) Level 10: 400 ms (Hard) Level 15: 150 ms (Very Hard)
      Returns:
      the delay in milliseconds between brick falls

    • getDelayForLevel

      public static int getDelayForLevel(int level)
      Gets the brick fall delay for a specific difficulty level.
      Parameters:
      level - the difficulty level (1, 5, 10, or 15)
      Returns:
      the delay in milliseconds between brick falls

    • getCurrentLevelDescription

      public String getCurrentLevelDescription()
      Gets a descriptive label for the current difficulty level.
      Returns:
      a string describing the difficulty (e.g., "LEVEL 1 - NORMAL")

    • getLevelDescription

      public static String getLevelDescription(int level)
      Gets a descriptive label for a specific difficulty level.
      Parameters:
      level - the difficulty level
      Returns:
      a string describing the difficulty

    • nextLevel

      public int nextLevel()
      Cycles to the next difficulty level. Order: 1 → 5 → 10 → 15 → 1 (cycles back)
      Returns:
      the new difficulty level

    • getNextLevel

      public int getNextLevel()
      Gets the next difficulty level without changing the current one.
      Returns:
      the next level in the cycle
